captions.text: Please, have a seat.

No, no, boys,
come over here in front of me.
l want to see your faces.

The county took a tax assessment
of this property last month.
They want $5,OOO.

Doesn't the church
have to pay that ?

They would if they were interested
in keeping the place,
but they aren't.

The archbishop wants to sell
this building to the Board of Education.

- What's gonna happen to you ?
- l'll be sent to the missions.
Africa. Latin America.

- Korea.
- Forget it !

Five grand ? No problem. We'll have
it for you in the morning. Let's go.

No, no ! l will not take
your filthy, stolen money !

Well, then, l guess
you're really up shit creek.
Ow !

l beg your pardon,
what did you say ?

- l offered to help you.
- Mm-hmm.

- You refused to take our money.
- Mm-hmm.

Then l said, ''l guess
you're really up shit creek.''

-Ow!
-Christ,Jake,takeiteasy,man.

- Elwood !
- Ow, shit !
- Jesus Christ ! Ow !

- Jesus Christ !
- Oh, fuck !

- Ow ! Shit ! Son of a bitch !
- Shit ! Goddamn it !
[ Both Continue Cussing ]

Ow !
You fat penguin !

- [ Yells ]
- [ Yells ]

- Fuck this noise, man !
- [ Yelling, Groaning ]

[ Slapping,
Groaning Continue ]
Ow! Ow! Ow!
[ Screaming ]
[ Screaming Continues ]

[ Nun ] You're such
a disappointing pair.

l prayed so hard for you.
It saddens and hurts me...

that the two young men whom l raised
to believe in the Ten Commandments...

have returned to me
as two thieves...

with filthy mouths
and bad attitudes.
Get out !
And don't come back...

until you've
redeemed yourselves.

title: Filthy Mouths & Bad Attitudes - The Blues Brothers (1/9) Movie CLIP (1980) HD

comments.author: Jenalyn Marie

comments.text:
Kun jokainen fiksu Suomalainen tekee jotain yhteiseksi hyväksi, pystymme 
helposti yhdessä pitämään huolta, auttamaan köyhiä ja elämästä 
sivussaolevia ihmisiä sekä tuomaan tarvittavat rakennemuutokset. 
Ilmoittaudu siis talkoisiin mukaan. Kerro mitä tahtoisit tehdä ja missä 
olla mukana. Kerro mitä sinä voit ja osaat tehdä yhteiseksi hyväksi. Niin 
tarkoitus on laittaa kaikki auttajat ja autettavat saman katon alle. 
Uskonnosta, politiikasta tai mistään eroittavasta asiasta huolimatta. On 
aika unohtaa vanhat kädenväännöt ja taistelut. On aika elää tätä päivää ja 
toimia, ennen kuin asiat ovat vielä huonommin. Kerro siis miten voit olla 
mukana. Kerro ideasi mitä pitäisi tehdä, että asiat muuttuvat.﻿

comments.text:
Kathleen Freeman, one of the greatest character actresses in film and 
television history. From "Singin in the Rain" and the "Dick Van Dyke Show" 
and "Hogan's Heroes" (remember her as General Burkhalter's sister 
Gertrude?) to "The Blues Brothers", impeccable timing, terrific comedic 
sense and visual presence. In less than ten minutes she almost stole the 
film. What a professional as well as a class act. Sadly, Ms. Freeman is 
gone as well but what a legacy.﻿
comments.author: Joseph Malham

comments.text:
Great performance from Kathleen Freeman. There is a lot of humanity and 
decency to the character. In her way she really cares about the boys. Very 
funny and touching scene. ﻿

comments.text:
In the TV version of this clip, the edited out all the swear words, so the 
clip made no sense.   They told the nun she was "in trouble" and she just 
starts beating the crap out of them for apparently no reason.   An example 
of where editing for television can just ruin a good story line.   I always 
thought this was really funny.  She hits them for saying a swear word, and 
they swear more when they are hit, so she hits again.﻿

comments.author: David Colantuono

comments.text:
I think you're right, those lines did seem different once I think about it. 
It's just that when it was called the extended version, I assumed it was a 
whole piece of the scene that was cut rather than just a line or two in the 
middle. Kind of threw me off.
comments.author: DiabolicalGenius

comments.text:
+DiabolicalGenius
That's right, the line about being sent to the missions was cut out of the 
theater version of the movie. I have it on VHS the way it was played in the 
theaters, but my brother in law has the DVD version with a lot of scenes 
left in, including how the Blues Mobile had the powers it had. Personally, 
I'm glad they omitted that part at the movies.
Even when Elwood has enough of getting hit with the stick and says "Fuck 
this noise!" and gets out of the desk chair and runs down the stairs, I 
think the "fuck this noise" line was also omitted out of that scene in the 
theater version. I don't remember hearing it in the movies or on my VHS 
tape.
comments.author: SpiritBear12

comments.text:
Ok, I just didn't notice anything different from the original cut. But 
thinking back maybe the line about the missions wasn't in that after all.
Might just be the fact that it's been years since I watched it.
comments.author: DiabolicalGenius

comments.text:
+DiabolicalGenius Actually, this is the extended version--I own a copy.  If 
I misinterpreted, my bad.
comments.author: Juliaflo

comments.text:
So what you meant to say was that there IS an extended version with 
dialogue that was cut from the original cut, and not that THIS is the 
extended version?

In any case if there's a director's cut on the 25th anniversary, maybe I 
should find it. It's one of the major films from my childhood after all.
comments.author: DiabolicalGenius

comments.text:
When a 25th anniversary DVD was released , it featured some of the extra 
dialogue not heard in the  movie theater.  For example, the lines about the 
sister describing the 'missions' she would be sent to were not mentioned in 
the theatrical version. (I saw the movie many times during the 
1980's---don't figure out my age, LOLOLOLOLOLOL).
comments.author: Juliaflo

comments.text:
Really? I grew up with this on a retail video copy at home that didn't have 
any mentions of being an extended cut or whatnot, and watched it at least a 
few hundred times throughout my youth. And it had this whole scene word for 
word, not a thing different.
Are you sure you aren't talking about the TV version? That had the bad 
laguage cut out to be more family friendly which made the whole scene make 
much less sense and nowhere near as funny.
comments.author: DiabolicalGenius

comments.text:
This is the extended version of the movie; much of the dialogue was 
eliminated from the final cut.

(Has it been 35 years????????????)

comments.author: Timothy Harwood

comments.text:
An interesting follow up note I was doing some research on the movie and it 
turns out that apparently the Vatican actually backs this movie and they 
apparently love it and often refer to this Nun as "The Catholic Classic" 
finding it a great example of a Nun. I don't know why but that just amuses 
me and thought it might amuse someone else. I guess I can understand "The 
Catholic Classic" thing but with everything else happens in the movie I 
just find it amusing that Vatican backs the movie up as being a good movie 
for the religiously devout.

comments.author: Pedro Lara

comments.text:
+vincent vangogh I agree with you about Landis being ahead of his time.  If 
you look at Blues Brothers, Animal House, American Werewolf in London to 
name just 3, all created a new style of comedy/drama that other, later 
films could only imitate.
comments.author: EASYTIGER10

comments.text:
+vincent vangogh Not completely true.

Granted, there were production delays and cost overruns, but the film did 
generate positive reviews, and did $115 million at the box office....not 
exactly all that bad, considering it was released waaaaaay back in 1980.
comments.author: floydefisher

comments.text:
+vincent vangogh
hmm... I wouldn't say BB veered towards a more popular, mainstream feel in 
the public hearts :) it rather has it's own life, and will continue to live 
for the blues lovers from everywhere
comments.author: flyingsnow00

comments.text:
+flyingsnow00 yeah john landis was ahead of his time, the movie bombed at 
the time but now we appreciate the sheer genius of the director and all the 
actors! that's why it's a cult classic now! you fat penguin! fantastic, and 
they still go on this quest to raise the amount of money in an honest way 
to save the orphanage! it's a true masterpiece the world simply wasn't 
ready for at the time!

teacher who looked a lot like Granny from the Beverly Hillbillies....and 
she was not much taller than the yard sticks..she would not hit kids with 
them but would break them over the desk or upside the desk (until it was 
about 12 inches or so long)...iirc she went through a box of those things 
about every couple of weeks
